Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to apply for permanent residence within instructed timeframe
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the immigration officer's decision to deny the H&C application unreasonable?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), subsection 25(1)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant lived in Canada for years without applying for permanent residency despite instructions; cited establishment and children's best interests
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Denial of humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) application
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent resident status on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national residing in Canada without permanent residency
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to apply for permanent residence within the instructed timeframe
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Establishment in Canada, best interests of children
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Degree of hardship, compliance with immigration laws
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Applicant’s length of stay, family ties, lack of evidence on hardship
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Insufficient evidence of unusual or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Governing_Rule: H&C exemption requires demonstration of unusual and undeserved or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of supporting evidence for hardship claims
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Officer found no significant hardship from departure
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant failed to apply for permanent residence within the instructed timeframe and faced denial of her H&C application
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered available evidence and found it insufficient
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA compliance obligations regarding timely application
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of documented hardship despite personal circumstances
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant – remained as visitor beyond expected timeline
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of immigration officer to assess H&C applications
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Findings based on established facts and legal thresholds
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Emphasis on applicant’s disregard for immigration laws and lack of exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient documentation to support hardship claim

Crimes.Violation_Type: Remaining in Canada beyond authorized period as a visitor
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the immigration officer's decision to deny the H&C application unreasonable?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), subsection 25(1)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visitor status for years; applied for permanent residence on H&C grounds citing child’s learning disability
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Denial of H&C application for permanent residence
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent resident status based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada after expiration of visitor visa
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Best interests of children, establishment in Canada, son’s learning disability
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Compliance history, establishment, risk of hardship upon removal
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of immigration officer's refusal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Credible but insufficient to establish disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Expert reports on child’s learning disability, duration of stay, family life in Canada
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations due to family circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Officer acknowledged evidence but found no disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Minister may grant relief if H&C grounds justify exemption
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to prove that relocation would cause disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Outcome: H&C application denied; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Moving to France would not result in disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant lived in Canada without permanent residency for years, applied for H&C grounds, and was denied due to insufficient hardship justification
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Evidence reviewed but deemed inadequate to meet legal threshold
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on temporary resident status and overstay
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Relevance and weight of expert evidence on child’s condition
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Scope of officer’s authority under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Balanced consideration of positive and negative factors
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Compliance with immigration laws weighed against family considerations; no exceptional hardship found
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Evidence present but not determinative of H&C grounds

Crimes.Crime_Name: Living in Canada without proper resident status
Crimes.Violation_Type: Prolonged residence without applying for permanent status
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the immigration officer's decision to deny the H&C application for permanent residency unreasonable?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), subsection 25(1)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant lived in Canada since 1996 without applying for permanent residency until 2006; claimed hardship based on children and establishment
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent resident status on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Long-term resident without legal permanent status
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Resided in Canada for a decade without seeking permanent residency
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Best interests of children, integration into Canadian society
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Length of stay, establishment, degree of hardship upon removal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not questioned, but claims not substantiated with evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Duration of residence, familial connections in Canada
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for exemption based on humanitarian and compassionate factors
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Lack of evidence demonstrating exceptional hardship
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Exemption allowed only where there is unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of hardship associated with leaving Canada
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No exceptional circumstances justifying exemption were found
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant remained in Canada for years without applying for permanent residency, leading to denial of her H&C application
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer evaluated submitted information and determined it did not meet threshold
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Obligation to regularize status in a timely manner under IRPA framework
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: General assertions without concrete documentation of hardship
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant – long-term stay without formal status adjustment
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of immigration officer to assess H&C claims
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Considered but found lacking in legal sufficiency
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Prolonged delay in applying undermined claim of urgency or hardship
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide detailed evidence supporting hardship claims
